text: Draught at Barcade, 8/26/16.Clear, light golden with a touch of copper and a small, white head that shows low retention.Light grassiness and minor herbal character shows low to moderate hoppiness, with quite a bit more malt adding spongecake, vanilla and whitebread. Clean, no alcohol but a bit too much maltiness, being rather sweet/bready so not even all that enjoyable (I have nothing against malt-forward pilsners, provided the malt is done well). Really not much else going on....Again, rather dominated by the malt portion, with plentiful breadiness and sweet honey. Expectedly, the saaz hops arent a tour de force of flavor and bitterness, but somethings gotta give here, because the beer ends up just too sweet/mushy. Had this been even a bit more dry, it would have come off far more balanced and drinkable. As is, its not particularly easy to even finish a pint of it. Otherwise, it is clean and there is no alcohol.
On Tap at BitterCreek Alehouse another slightly hazy pale yellow lager. Nice bitter soapy spicy hop note carrying a soft malt base. Light beer with still some decent flavor.

Pours straw yellow with a one finger white head with nice lacing. Aroma is of pils malts, grassy hops, some herbal hops, bready malts, light sweet malts, and some light pine. Taste is about the same as the aroma. Has a medium-light body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, semi bitter, medium-long finish. Overall, a tasty, refreshing, easy drinking pils.

Tap. Xfinity Live. PSU vs Temple. Poured a slightly hazy yellow gold body with a small fizzy white head. The nose is dry bready malt and a clean crisp hoppiness. The flavor is much the same, very clean and dry with a crisp and sharp bitterness that lingers nicely. A little more body than their usual Pils. Light to medium bodied with soft fizzy carbonation. Pretty great beer, about what I expect from a Victory lager.
Draft at the source. Crystal clear golden color, thick white head with solid lacing. Aroma of black peppery and fresh hay. Taste is crisp and clean, light body.
Saab hop flavor with malty sweet body. Not the hop prescience and ibu I would expect from a Pilsner.

Transfer from BA review on 8-12-12-

 Served on tap in a pint glass

 Appearance  The beer is served a clear golden straw color with a fizzy one finger white head. The head fades rather rapidly leaving a light level of lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is a mix of some biscuit and a bit of lemon and earthiness. Along with these smells are some lighter notes of grain and some caramel sweetness.

 Taste  The taste starts out with a blend of a biscuit malt and a bit of caramel sweetness. As the taste advances a small amount of a pear and apricot fruit flavor join the taste sweetening the brew ever so slightly with a little bit of a grapefruit hop coming along to balance out the aforementioned increase in sweetness. A tiny bit of a yeast and spice and some grassy hop join the flavors at the end to leave a clean and crisp taste on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer was on the thinner side overall with a carbonation level that was average to slightly above average. Both were quite appropriate for the style and made for a rather refreshing brew overall.

 Overall  Quite easy drinking and rather refreshing. Nothing too out of the ordinary but nice none the less.
Draft notes. Pours golden with white head. Nose is bready pale malt, hopcitrus. tastes pale malty, some yeastiness, some hops, and tart fruit in the finish.
Chill tap courtesy offered @ deep ellum just two days ago. Clean crisp soft wet grass. Lightly bitter lemingrass. Cracker. Cereal. Crisp. Refreshing. Touch of foggy cellar dough. Nice.
Draft at Harrison Roadhouse. Copper with minimal head. Candy and sweet malt. Grainy and dry.

I thot this was the best of the 4 samples I tasted at the bocktown, one mug of on tap fun each. thn head and clear almost lemon yellow. smell is clean and fresh, not bad but sterile. decent fresh taste. easy to like, gentleman. friendly overall, good beer experience. slight bitter bite but you can only perceive it near the end. I liked that.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Draft. Poured a clear pale color with a moderate frothy white head that lasted and had good lacing. Medium floral hop and earthy malt aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium bittersweet flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. This beer exceeded my expectations.

Draft to pint at Dutchs. Looks good for the style; a transparent gold with white head. Smells doughy and lightly hoppy. Tastes like it smells, only more robust, with a crisp, refreshing mouthfeel. Enjoyable.

Pours a fuzzy yellow with limited head hat quickly dissipates. Tastes is solid and hits the spot in a hot day. Fine lager, but could use more hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Dutchs. Clear yellow color. Thin white head. Few loose splotches of lace. Good clean bready aroma, lightly peppery, no off-flavors. Satisfying, but not intrusive amount of hops. Light hint of lemon citrus. Smooth, crisp, lighter carbonation. Slightly dry in the finish. Light to medium body. Moderate sweet taste, light bitter. Tasty, well-done pilsener. Victory knows pilseners. This is up to their standard.

Lightest gold, totally transparent, head dies like Smaragd but more effervescent. Light bubblegum esters at beginning of nose, oily pine c notes. flavor starts estery, but warmth dries it, more grass and victory grain husks through short finish. Lighty resinous for victory, lacking in richness of their best lagers, reminiscent of prima with a stronger, more resinous hop finish.

Tap at proof. Crystal clear pale straw with white head that dissipates. Sweet bread/cracker aroma with a touch of honey and earth. Sweet cracker grain with some earth hop bite. Good and drinkable but I want more of a hop crisp finish.

Pours a clear yellow on tap with thin white cap that leaves light lacing. Aroma of grassy pils malts, light spicy sweetness on the back end. Taste is bready grain and lager crispness. Nothing special, but easy to drink.

Draft at Proof. Clear golden pour with a small white head. Pale malt sweetness, grassy, floral notes with hints of catty aspects. Sweet entry, honey notes, floral and grassy hops present. Clean easy drinking and refreshing. Spicy hop finish. Not bad.
Draft at Whole Foods Plymouth Meeting. Pours a clean gold with very little head that quickly dissipates and no lace. Notes of grass, hay, honey, lemon, citrus. Slightly bitter finish.

On tap at Bangers & Lace. Pours a clear crisp gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges and laces. Aroma has grassy hops with a backing of earthy grains. Flavor has a lot of earthy grains and earthy grass with a bit of light pine.

Clear golden colored body, medium sized white head, spotty lacing.  Grassy hops with some floral and citrus notes.  Pleasant pale malts are present in good balance. Light bodied, assertive carbonation, refreshing finish.

Hazy golden color with a small, white head that left light lacing on the glass.  Aroma of grass, toast, toffee, pine, and light citrus. Taste of toasty malts, bread, citrus, and light grassy bitterness.
Very enjoyable.  On draft at the brewery.  Nice, stiff white head.  Crisp, a bit of wet grass, nice dry bite.  Very refreshing.

Pours clear gold with a small fluffy white head.  Aroma is citrus, grass and floral.  Taste is sweet with a crisp tart finish.  Light bodied with a smooth mouth feel.  Very refreshing and flavorful, perfect for the summer.
